Nerangs.ab: ō ī zōt gāh bē šawišn ud bē gōwišn yazāi āpəm āb bē nigerišn arəduuīm sūrąm anāhitąm. ...
"He has to go back to the zōtgāh and recite: yazāi āpəm. He has to gaze at the water (and continue with) arəduuīm sūrąm anāhitąm. ...

Quotations.ab: Y65.1-6 (=Yt5.1-5 +Y65.6) are recited as well as part of the Āb-zōhr with Drōn Yašt described in the Nērangestān. Two variants are described, a lesser (N53.27-29) and a greater one (N53.30-31).

"In the greater (celebration of the Āb-zōhr), (the rāspīg has to recite)ązasca dužāθrəmca āfrīnāmi, one Aṣ̌əm Vohū and ẏaθā ahū vairiiō ẏō frabərətō frā.mē mrūte. The zōt (has to recite) one Aṣ̌əm Vohū. The rāspīg has to take the wāz and recite ahurəm mazdąm (VrS11.33) until āca manō mata āca ẏazamaide (VrS11.34) until varəš́iiamnaca (VrS11.36) ẏeŋ́hē hātąm until yazamaide (VrS11.37) and vaŋᵛhīm iδāt̰ āδąm vaŋᵛhīm aṣ̌īm (Y68.22)

daxšmaēstim aētat̰ barəsma' ẏat̰ paiti āpəm *frānaiiata * daxšmēst ān barsom ka pad ān ī āb frāz šawē hamē ka andar *daxšmēst harw ēn dō ẏazāi āpəm *ōh gōwēd ay daxšmēst harw ēn dō ẏazāi āpəm andar *daxšmēst guftan.

daxšmaēstim aētat̰ barəsma' ẏat̰ paiti āpəm *frānaiiata (Translation: “One takes this barəsman a dakšmaēsti towards the water”) If that barsom should go towards the water (to the extent of) a daxšmēst [whenever it should come within a daxšmēst (from the water), both (zōt and rāspīg) should recite ẏazāi āpəm . That is: a daxšmēst, both should recite ẏazāi āpəm within a daxšmēst (from the water).
